conclusion: Determine if average kinetic energy increases or decreases from D to A.
Transition from D to A is a vertical line on P-V diagram, volume constant, pressure increases.
A→B and C→D are isothermal processes.
Average kinetic energy is proportional to temperature.
Determine temperature change from D to A; if temperature increases, kinetic energy increases.
Increase in pressure at constant volume indicates increase in temperature.
Since temperature increases from D to A, average kinetic energy increases.
Final answer: Average kinetic energy increases from D to A.
